function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Shift in homebuyer preferences and housing locations due to covid-19 could lead to spread of contagious diseases in new residential areas.","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential for increased density in urban areas due to the need for affordable housing. this could lead to higher risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Conversion of office spaces in city centers to residential units could lead to changes in population density and potential disease exposure.","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Shortages of affordable housing for low-income people and families","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Decrease in road traffic flows and major cities experiencing drops in rush-hour traffic congestion","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased investment in energy efficiency and retrofitting of buildings","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spread of infection in cities due to close contact in vulnerable households, construction sites, and local businesses.","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on digital platforms for cultural resources, municipal services, and participation may lead to increased virtual interactions and dependence.","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential long-term coexistence with covid-19 leading to ongoing public health concerns and the need for sustainable recovery strategies.","category":"","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Vulnerable groups such as the elderly, women, the poor, and migrants disproportionately affected by
